column1: 2 ^ Exsultāte Deō adjūtōrī nostrō; jūbilāte Deō Jācōbis. ^ Rejoice to God our helper; sing aloud to the God of Jacob.

column2: et date timpanum; psaltērium jūcundum cum cittarā. ^ Take a psalm
column3: and bring hither the timbrel; the pleasant psaltery with the harp.
^ Give sound with the trumpet on the new moon
column4: on the noted day of your solemnity

column2: et jūdicium Deō Jācōbis. ^ for it is a commandment in Israel
column3: and a judgment to the God of Jacob.

column2: quum exīret dē terrā Aegiptī; linguam quam nōn nōverat
column3: audīvit. ^ He ordained it for a testimony in Joseph
column4: when he came out of the land of Egypt; a tongue which he knew not

column1: 7 ^ Dīvertit ab oneribus dorsum ejus; manūs ejus in cofinō servīvērunt. ^ He removed his back from the burdens; his hands had served in baskets.

column2: et līberāvī tē; exaudīvī tē in absconditō tempestātis; probāvī tē apud aquam contrādictiōnis. ^ Thou calledst upon me in affliction
column3: and I delivered thee; I heard thee in the secret place of tempest; I proved thee at the waters of contradiction.

column6: and I will testify to thee; O Israel
column7: if thou wilt hearken to me.

column1: 10 ^ Nōn erit in tē deus recens
column2: neque adōrābis deum aliēnum. ^ There shall be no new god in thee
column3: nor shalt thou adore a strange god.

column1: 11 ^ Egō enim sum Dominus Deus tuus
column2: quī ēdūxī tē dē terrā Aegiptī; dīlātā os tuum
column3: et implēbō illud. ^ For I am the Lord thy God
column4: who brought thee out of the land of Egypt; open thy mouth wide

column1: 12 ^ Et nōn audīvit populus meus vōcem meam
column2: et Isrāēl nōn intendit mihi. ^ But my people heard not my voice
column3: and Israel hearkened not to me.

column1: 13 ^ Et dīmīsī eōs secundum dēsīderia cordis eōrum; ībunt in adinventiōnibus suīs. ^ So I let them go according to the desires of their heart; they shall walk in their own inventions.

column2: Isrāēl sī in viīs meīs ambulāsset
column3: ^ If my people had heard me
column4: if Israel had walked in my ways

column1: 15 ^ prō nihilō forsitan inimīcōs eōrum humiliāssem
column2: et super trībulantēs eōs mīsissem manum meam. ^ I should soon have humbled their enemies
column3: and laid my hand on them that troubled them.

column2: et erit tempus eōrum in saecula. ^ The enemies of the Lord have lied to him
column3: and their time shall be for ever.

column1: 17 ^ Et cibāvit eōs ex adipe frūmentī
column3: melle saturāvit eōs. ^ And he fed them with the fat of wheat
column4: and filled them with honey out of the rock.
